name: Inn at Middletown

reviews.title: Nicest hotel in the area
reviews.text: We visited Wesleyan University and stayed at the Inn. It is incredibly charming and a very friendly hotel. The food in the restaurant is wonderful, a little pricey, but very good. The guest room is nicely decorated and the bed quite comfortable. If our son is admitted into Wesleyan, we certainly know where to stay when we visit.

reviews.title: Nice, but buggy
reviews.text: The Inn at Middletown apppeared to be the perfect hotel. The room seemed clean and well decorated, the workers friendly and approachable, and the restaurant good. The location certainly can't be beat if you're visiting the nearby Weslsyan University. However this means little to me as I woke up to find the a large cluster of bug bites behind my knee (I'm assuming bedbugs). The cluster of bites has remained for over a week. Gross! So, The Inn at Middletown appears to be a very nice stay, but beware of the bugs.

reviews.title: Definitely worth the stay
reviews.text: Unfortunately the reason why we were here was because of a funeral for a close relative in late Feb of this year (2005). We are originally from Ct and moved to Virginia. We had about 4 or 5 rooms reserved for relatives from different states as well. So basically it was kind of like a family reunion also. This hotel definitely made it memorable for everyone. If you ever need a place to stay where it is convenient, clean, and classy this is the place to stay. The prices do vary but affordable for this type of place. The staff was very friendly and helpful. It also has valet parking in which isn't so bad considering that parking on the street isn't such a good idea especially when it snows. Our kids loved the pool & jacuzzi. The restaurant had very good food and the bar was very relaxing. Overall , if you are tired of hotels that are overpriced and not worth the money and don't really have that relaxing feeling then you will not be disappointed at this one. So whenever you are in the area and need a nice place to stay, you know where to go.

reviews.title: New England Charm
reviews.text: What a great little hotel just a block from Wesleyan University!

Stayed here for my cousin's wedding. The Rehersal dinner party was here was very nicely done. However, trash pick-up took place at 3:30 and 4:30 in the morning of the Sunday night at the commercial establishments just next door. One would think the hotel ws under attack! Can the management do amything to rescheduel trrash pick-up?
reviews.title: Lovely hotel except for middle-of-the-night trash pick-up

reviews.text: By far this was the nicest hotel I've stayed in, in a long time. There is nothing better then comfortable beds, warm environment, and such friendly staff. The employees were very friendly. The valet guy, Brian was so funny, he was always cracking a joke and had some great recommendations for restaurants in the area.The girl at the desk, Stephaine constantly had a smile and she helped me get the room I wanted looking over main street, and she helped my rather difficult colleague get the room he wanted on the bottom floor near the door so he can smoke. When I was there the computer in the business center was broken but at the front desk she was more then willing to help me print out my boarding pass and a document I needed. The beds there are very comfortable, a little on the hard side because I think there the temper pedic beds but still comfortable and the restaurant was small, but very good. I really enjoyed the breakfast. Overall, my stay was great and my colleague and I will definitely be coming back to the Inn.
reviews.title: Even though it was business, It was still a treat.

reviews.text: Well i arived at the inn last weekend and i pull up in my car when i look up there he was with a nice smile and nice voice tone.... name tagg "Alexis" called Pepe... he help me with my bagge and car the best valet parking ever... and in the front desk "Yvone" nice yong lady that puts a smile on you'r face, rooms fantastic, food not much, if u going to Middle Town CT. this is the place.
reviews.title: the best valet parking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For the price, Inn at Middletown was pleasant and comfortable. The rooms are standard hotel rooms with no special features. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The facility was spotless. The bed, however, was uncomfortable.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.text: Wonderful inn near Wesleyan University. Built around the structure of an old armory, the place is both elegant and comfortable. Rooms are clean and nicely furnished. Bathrooms are not luxurious but fixtures are up-to-date and clean. Staff was extremely nice and helpful. The restaurant attached to the hotel, the Tavern at the Amory, is elegant and full of character. Will definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: quite a gem

reviews.text: We were really happy with our stay at the Inn at Middletown. The hotel is just the right mix of quaint and swanky. The small lobby is beautiful and inviting and the staffmembers at the reception desk were very pleasant and efficient. Our room was large and overlooked the river out back. Everything was spotless. We had breakfast in the restaurant and both the service and food were good. The pool is small but fine and the whirlpool is nice. The location is excellent and easy to find. This is a great little hotel!
reviews.title: Great Place!

reviews.text: The Inn at Middletown, as many have mentioned is a converted armory that has a distinct New England feel. The sweeping entrance and friendly staff make this Inn worth a visit to see friends or family.
reviews.title: Perfect night to prepare

likes.liked: — Quaint feel, even though it was opened within the past 3 years

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed this week with a customer of mine under the Aetna corporate rate. Even though we didn't pay the regular rates, the hotel is certainly worth it at the regular rates for its "cute" and friendly tavern and staff that is willing to do nearly anything for you. My first floor room was quiet and while there was no view I was distracted by preparations for my customer site visit anyway. We took in dinner at the Sage American Grill about 15 minutes south, which was a delight.
reviews.title: A wonderful experience

likes.liked: — Comfortable, clean, nicely appointed - fantastic staff!

reviews.text: Rooms were extremely clean -- a typical hotel size with two queen beds and small desk with business style chair. The television had typical lodgenet services. Bathrooms were stocked with Bath and Body works amenities. The show power was good and plenty of hot water even at peak times. Coffee and tea is available in the lobby in the morning.
reviews.title: Best bet in Middletown - Good but not great

reviews.text: IMy husband and I had a wonderful three night stay at the Inn. We stayed there during Christmas (12/23-12/26) so that we could visit family in nearby towns. We were warmly welcomed and kindly treated by everyone with whom we came into contact at the Inn. Our room (a 1 bedroom suite) was well appointed, very comfortable, and nicely kept; our room service breakfasts were delicious and filling; the front desk "team" was a cheerful and invaluable source of information and help; and the entire Inn was charming! We look forward to another stay!
reviews.title: Excellence!

reviews.text: We were here for the night on day four of our college tour of the East Coast. The Inn is very close to Wesleyan (just walk out and you're there) and in the middle of the action of Middletown , if there was any action, which there isn't.
reviews.title: Rah Rah For the Inn

reviews.text: The Inn is very clean, the rooms are large (we had a double and a 1 bedroom suite), staff were pleasant (but still didn't get us the two queen bed room we initially asked for). Bathrooms are perfectly fine. There's no view to speak of as the hotel looks out on the main street of the town. The public areas are East Coast traditional, well lit and comfortable.
reviews.title: Fabulous Place To Stay, Eat & Entertain! Have used the Inn many times!

reviews.text: We drove up to the small semi-circular driveway and used Valet, which worked out well. The bell man was relatively prompt and was patient as we split up our bags between two rooms on two different floors.
reviews.title: Beautiful, Clean Rooms, Friendly Staff, Great Food

reviews.text: We came in, had dinner down the street, went to bed and left in the morning. So for the brief time we spent here we were perfectly happy. I'd never come here for Middletown, but when college touring or visiting friends, this is a very easy choice to make.
reviews.title: Great Place
Loved the area
reviews.text: I am a former resident of Killingworth CT, 15 minutes away from Middletown. When I heard about the armory being renovated I thought it was terrific - and I decided to hold our 10 year HS reunion there in June 2004. We also stayed the night there. Everything was absolutely wonderful. The room was large with sitting area and seperate bedroom area which was perfect for us to put together those last minute details. Our personal room was spotless and the room we held the reunion in was beautiful. It was clean, the service was great, the staff was friendly and the food we had at the reunion was terrific. They were also very accomodating to our budget needs. So many people wrote in to say they had such a great time.

description: Opened November 2003, the former National Guard Armory on historic Main Street in downtown Middletown has been transformed into a 100 room boutique hotel. The marble lobby is enhanced by a spiral staircase that goes up to the second level pre-function area. Guests can enjoy a variety of on-site amenities including the Tavern at the Armory restaurant and lounge, indoor heated pool, exercise room, and Jacuzzi. In-room dining, free high speed internet access in all rooms, and valet parking.
